docs.snippet: Germany's World Cup triumph has seen them rise to the top of the world rankings for the first time in 20 years, FIFA announced on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Germany's World Cup triumph has seen them rise to the top of the world rankings for the first time in 20 years, FIFA announced on Thursday.

headline.main: FIFA Rankings Put Germany on Top of the World
headline.print_headline: FIFA Rankings Put Germany on Top of the World

docs.snippet: At a summertime getaway for liberals, Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren has captured the hearts of Democratic activists beginning to think about an heir to President Barack Obama. But their minds tell them that Hillary Rodham Clinton could help...
docs.lead_paragraph: At a summertime getaway for liberals, Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren has captured the hearts of Democratic activists beginning to think about an heir to President Barack Obama. But their minds tell them that Hillary Rodham Clinton could help them hang onto the White House.

headline.main: Liberals Swoon for Warren, Point to Clinton in '16
headline.print_headline: Liberals Swoon for Warren, Point to Clinton in '16

docs.snippet: Harry Redknapp believes England need to stop trying to emulate other international teams and focus on creating their own footballing identity, the Queens Park Rangers manager said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Harry Redknapp believes England need to stop trying to emulate other international teams and focus on creating their own footballing identity, the Queens Park Rangers manager said on Friday.

headline.main: Don't Copy Germany, Redknapp Urges England
headline.print_headline: Don't Copy Germany, Redknapp Urges England

docs.snippet: England captain Steven Gerrard has announced his retirement from international soccer, the Football Association said on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: England captain Steven Gerrard has announced his retirement from international soccer, the Football Association said on Monday.

headline.main: England Captain Gerrard Retires From Internationals
headline.print_headline: England Captain Gerrard Retires From Internationals

docs.snippet: The South Korea Football Association hope to appoint a new technical chief this week, the first step in a overhaul that will end with a new head coach after their disappointing World Cup showing in Brazil.
docs.lead_paragraph: The South Korea Football Association hope to appoint a new technical chief this week, the first step in a overhaul that will end with a new head coach after their disappointing World Cup showing in Brazil.

headline.main: South Korea in No Rush to Appoint New Coach
headline.print_headline: South Korea in No Rush to Appoint New Coach

docs.snippet: After scoring the most goals of any player at the World Cup, Colombia forward James Rodriguez signed a six-year deal with Real Madrid on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: After scoring the most goals of any player at the World Cup, Colombia forward James Rodriguez signed a six-year deal with Real Madrid on Tuesday.

headline.main: James Rodriguez Signs 6-Year Deal With Real Madrid
headline.print_headline: James Rodriguez Signs 6-Year Deal With Real Madrid

docs.snippet: The Spanish powerhouse paid the French club Monaco a transfer fee of about $108 million to sign Colombian forward James Rodríguez, a breakout star at the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Spanish powerhouse paid the French club Monaco a transfer fee of about $108 million to sign Colombian forward James Rodríguez, a breakout star at the World Cup.
docs.abstract: Champions League titleholder Real Madrid adds James Rodriguez, young Colombian player and breakout star of 2014 World Cup, to its roster after paying $108 transfer fee to French club Monaco.

headline.seo: James Rodríguez Joins Toni Kroos in Revamped Lineup
headline.main: Real Madrid Reaches Deal With World Cup’s Top Scorer
headline.print_headline: Real Madrid Reaches Deal With World Cup’s Top Scorer

docs.snippet: In addition to drafting up love letters to mechanical pencils, paintbrushes and Sharpies, a set of authors, designers and artists illustrated the objects they trust and use the most.
docs.abstract: In addition to drafting up love letters to mechanical pencils, paintbrushes and Sharpies, a set of authors, designers and artists illustrated the objects they trust and use the most.

headline.main: Creative Types From Manolo Blahnik to Milton Glaser on Their Favorite Writing and Drawing Instruments

docs.snippet: Former Mexico coach Javier Aguirre has been appointed to manage Japan's national team replacing Alberto Zaccheroni, local media reported on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Former Mexico coach Javier Aguirre has been appointed to manage Japan's national team replacing Alberto Zaccheroni, local media reported on Thursday.

headline.main: Japan Name Former Mexico Boss Aguirre as Coach
headline.print_headline: Japan Name Former Mexico Boss Aguirre as Coach

docs.snippet: Pablo Cuevas of Uruguay upset sixth-seeded Andreas Seppi of Italy 6-3, 6-1 on Thursday to become the first qualifier to reach the Croatia Open quarterfinals in seven years.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pablo Cuevas of Uruguay upset sixth-seeded Andreas Seppi of Italy 6-3, 6-1 on Thursday to become the first qualifier to reach the Croatia Open quarterfinals in seven years.

headline.main: Qualifier Cuevas Upsets Seppi in Umag 2nd Round
headline.print_headline: Qualifier Cuevas Upsets Seppi in Umag 2nd Round
